title: Tehuantepec Style Chile Chicken (Pollo Enchilado Estilo Tehuantepec)
ingredients: 12 chiles guajillos, stemmed, seeded and deveined
½ teaspoon Mexican cinnamon, in small bits
8 separate pieces of chicken, skin removed (approximately 2 complete 3-pound chickens)
instructions: In a small saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a full boil.  Put the chiles into a small bowl and pour the boiling water over them (the chiles should all be fully covered by water).  Let them soak for 10 to 15 minutes.

Put all the spices, chiles, and ½ cup of the soaking water into a blender, and puree the mixture.  Don’t worry about how fine the puree turns out as you should see be bits of chile skin in the mixture.  Rub this marinade over the chicken and allow it to sit for ½ hour.
Place the marinated chicken in a casserole and bake it, covered, for 1 hour.
source: Seasons of My Heart, A Culinary Journey Through Oaxaca, Mexico by Susana Trilling, published by The Ballantine Publishing Group, © 1999 by Susana Trilling.
